intro: Dorstenia foetida, commonly known as the stinking custard apple, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fleshy, and often fragrant fruits. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are palmately lobed and can be hairy, while the stems are often swollen and ribbed. The fruit, which is edible when ripe, has a strong, unpleasant odor that attracts certain pollinators.
